channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Nigeria detains American Binance executive over dispute with the crypto company
item.description: In Nigeria, an American man is caught up in a dispute between the government and the crypto currency exchange Binance. Some lawmakers say that Nigeria is effectively holding him hostage.
item.content:encoded: In Nigeria, an American man is caught up in a dispute between the government and the crypto currency exchange Binance. Some lawmakers say that Nigeria is effectively holding him hostage.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Hurricane Debby is dangerously rainy because it formed over abnormally warm water
item.description: Hurricane Debby is trundling across the Southeast, dropping massive amounts of rain. The storm formed over abnormally warm ocean water.
item.content:encoded: Hurricane Debby is trundling across the Southeast, dropping massive amounts of rain. The storm formed over abnormally warm ocean water.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hersher

item.title: Sweden's Mondo raises his own bar to set new Olympic and world record in pole vault
item.description: The American-Swede made his eager fans wait until his final attempt at clinching a new world record at the Paris Olympics — knocking down his own by .01 meters.
item.content:encoded:
The American-Swede made his eager fans wait until his final attempt at clinching a new world record at the Paris Olympics — knocking down his own by .01 meters.

(Image credit: Martin Meissner)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Despair in the West Bank is driving a desire among young men to die for a cause
item.description: Growing despair in the West Bank is leading to a rise desire among young Palestinian men to die by fighting the Israeli occupation.
item.content:encoded: Growing despair in the West Bank is leading to a rise desire among young Palestinian men to die by fighting the Israeli occupation.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Photos: Bangladesh PM flees the country after weeks of deadly protests
item.description: This follows the weeks of protests over job quotas that saw clashes between protestors and ruling party supporters, and several instances of police brutality. The death toll from the crackdown ran into hundreds, and precipitated calls for Hasina’s resignation.
item.content:encoded:
This follows the weeks of protests over job quotas that saw clashes between protestors and ruling party supporters, and several instances of police brutality. The death toll from the crackdown ran into hundreds, and precipitated calls for Hasina’s resignation.

(Image credit: Anik Rahman)
item.dc:creator: Omkar Khandekar

item.title: A look at Bangladesh's new chapter
item.description: Bangladesh's army chief says he'll form an interim government after the long-serving prime minister fled the country amid outrage over violent crackdowns against students.
item.content:encoded: Bangladesh's army chief says he'll form an interim government after the long-serving prime minister fled the country amid outrage over violent crackdowns against students.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: An NBA star helped put a spotlight on the U.S. women's table tennis team
item.description: The U.S. has never won an Olympic medal in table tennis. But the interest of an NBA star has helped put a spotlight on the three-member women's team ahead of its first event Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. has never won an Olympic medal in table tennis. But the interest of an NBA star has helped put a spotlight on the three-member women's team ahead of its first event Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: How U.S. men's basketball is preparing for Olympics quarterfinals
item.description: As the U.S. men's basketball team prepared for Tuesday’s game against Brazil, NPR's Juana Summers talked the team’s managing director, Grant Hill, to ask how he views the competition.
item.content:encoded: As the U.S. men's basketball team prepared for Tuesday’s game against Brazil, NPR's Juana Summers talked the team’s managing director, Grant Hill, to ask how he views the competition.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: Israel Waits for Retaliation From Iran; Some West Bank Men Want to Become Martyrs
item.description:
Iran has vowed to strike Israel following the assassination of a Hamas leader on Iran's soil. We hear from Israelis watching and waiting as they know an attack is coming but the don't know when.

And in the West Bank, the war between Israel and Hamas has sparked an increase in Palestinian men wanting to die fighting Israeli occupation.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.content:encoded:
Iran has vowed to strike Israel following the assassination of a Hamas leader on Iran's soil. We hear from Israelis watching and waiting as they know an attack is coming but the don't know when.

And in the West Bank, the war between Israel and Hamas has sparked an increase in Palestinian men wanting to die fighting Israeli occupation.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Hurricane Debby made landfall in southeast U.S., causing flooding and power outages
item.description: Hurricane Debby made landfall Monday morning causing major power outages and flooding throughout the Florida, Georgia and South Carolina.
item.content:encoded: Hurricane Debby made landfall Monday morning causing major power outages and flooding throughout the Florida, Georgia and South Carolina.
item.dc:creator: Kerry Sheridan
